title: Lucene database bindings
description: Code and examples for embedding Lucene in HSQLDB and Derby relational databases.

comments.content: Core database code, example client classes and example data to integrate Lucene with Derby and HSQLDB
comments.author: Mark Harwood

comments.content:
Hey Mark,

Are you still interested in this?  Perhaps a patch would be useful.
comments.author: Grant Ingersoll

comments.content:
Hi Grant,
I've not done any more on this or used it in anger. It was an interesting experiment and could probably benefit from an upgrade to the new 2.3 version of Lucene. I suspect the new IndexWriter update/delete functionality would make it much easier to add support for synching of Lucene indexes using  database triggers. 

Unfortunately I don't have any time available currently or a pressing need to do this.
comments.author: Mark Harwood

comments.content: Note: Lucene 4.0's DocValueFields aka column stride fields will be of benefit here in efficient KeyMap implementations - e.g. updating the load routines in CachedKeyMapImpl. An overhaul is also needed e.g support segment-level mappings
comments.author: Mark Harwood
